question: Pravasi Bharatiya Divas 2025 is observed on which date and what is its theme?
option_1: January 9 – Diaspora’s Contribution to a Viksit Bharat
option_2: January 10 – Global Indians for Sustainable Development
option_3: January 8 – Indian Diaspora: Reliable Partners for Amrit Kaal
option_4: January 11 – Celebrating Overseas Indian Culture
solution:
• Celebrated on January 9, marking Mahatma Gandhi's return from South Africa in 1915
  • 2025 theme: Diaspora’s Contribution to a Viksit Bharat
  • 18th Convention held from January 8–10, 2025 in Bhubaneswar, Odisha
  • Events included Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Awards and youth engagement
  • Gandhi’s return symbolized the power of overseas Indians to contribute to India’s transformation — he had led a successful Satyagraha movement in South Africa, and upon return, began shaping India’s freedom struggle

question: World Wetlands Day is observed on which date?
solution:
• Observed annually on February 2, marking the adoption of the Ramsar Convention in 1971 in Ramsar, Iran
  • Started in 1997 as a global awareness campaign; officially recognized by the UN in 2021
  • 2025 theme: Protecting Wetlands for Our Common Future
  • Total Ramsar wetlands in India (as of June 2025): 91 sites
  • Newest additions (2025):
    • Khichan (Phalodi, Rajasthan)
    • Menar (Udaipur, Rajasthan)
    • Khecheopalri Wetland (Sikkim – first for the state)
    • Udhwa Lake (Jharkhand – first for the state)
    • Sakkarakottai & Therthangal Bird Sanctuaries (Tamil Nadu)
  • Wetlands are celebrated for their role in biodiversity, water purification, flood control, and climate regulation

question: World Cancer Day is observed on which date?
solution:
• Observed annually on February 4, to raise awareness about cancer and promote prevention, detection, and treatment
  • Started in 2000, following the signing of the Charter of Paris Against Cancer
  • Led by UICC (Union for International Cancer Control)
  • 2025 theme: United by Unique — emphasizing personalized, inclusive cancer care
  • Cancer causes over 10 million deaths annually, making it a critical global health issue

question: What is the theme of World Radio Day 2025?
option_2: Radio and Climate Change
option_3: Radio and Digital Inclusion
option_4: Radio: A Voice for the Voiceless
solution:
• 2025 theme: Radio and Climate Change
  • Focuses on radio’s role in raising awareness about climate issues
  • Encourages sustainable practices and environmental education
  • Celebrated annually on February 13, marking the founding of United Nations Radio in 1946
  • Inventor of radio: Guglielmo Marconi, who patented the first wireless telegraphy system in 1896

question: World Wildlife Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on March 3, marking the adoption of the CITES agreement (Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species) in 1973
  • Started by the United Nations in 2013 to promote awareness about wildlife conservation
  • 2025 theme: Wildlife Conservation Finance: Investing in People and Planet
  • Total wildlife sanctuaries in India (as of 2025): 573 sanctuaries, covering 123,762.56 sq km, which is 76% of India’s land area
  • Wildlife sanctuaries protect endangered species, biodiversity, and ecological balance
  • Value of wildlife:
  • Ecological: Maintains food chains, pollination, and nutrient cycles
  • Medicinal: Source of compounds for life-saving drugs
  • Economic: Supports tourism, agriculture, and livelihoods
  • Cultural: Integral to traditions, art, and indigenous knowledge
  • Climate resilience: Forest and marine wildlife help in carbon sequestration and ecosystem stability

question: What is the theme of International Women’s Day 2025?
option_3: Women in Technology and Innovation
option_4: Empowering Women in Leadership
solution:
• Observed annually on March 8, celebrating women's progress and advocating for gender justice
  • Initiated in 1911, originally proposed by Clara Zetkin in 1910 at the International Socialist Women’s Conference
  • UN Theme (2025): Accelerate Action — promoting urgent, measurable steps towards gender equality
  • IWD Website Theme (2025): For ALL Women and Girls: Rights, Equality, Empowerment
  • Theme highlights the need to honour women’s achievements, support inclusive rights, and empower marginalized voices globally
  • National Women’s Day in India: 13 February, in memory of Sarojini Naidu (Nightingale of India)
  • Official Colors:
  • Purple – Symbolizes Justice
  • Green – Represents Hope
  • White – Signifies Purity

question: What is the theme of World Consumer Rights Day 2025?
option_1: A Just Transition to Sustainable Lifestyles
option_3: Consumer Justice and Digital Safety
option_4: Fair Trade for All
solution:
• 2025 theme: A Just Transition to Sustainable Lifestyles
  • Focuses on making sustainable and healthy choices accessible, affordable, and inclusive
  • Observed globally on March 15, commemorating President John F. Kennedy’s 1962 speech recognizing consumer rights
  • Aims to raise awareness about consumer protection and fair trade practices
  • Educates consumers about their rights to:
    • Safety
    • Information
    • Choice
    • Redressal
    • Consumer education
  • National Consumer Rights Day (India): 24 December, marks the enactment of the Consumer Protection Act, 1986 (replaced by the Consumer Protection Act, 2019)

question: National Vaccination Day is observed on which date?
solution:
• Observed annually on March 16, marking the first oral polio vaccine dose administered in India in 1995 under the Pulse Polio Programme.
  • Inventor of the first vaccine: Edward Jenner, who developed the smallpox vaccine in 1796 using cowpox virus.
  • Also known as “National Immunization Day”, emphasizing the role of vaccines in public health.
  • 2025 theme: Vaccines Work for All — highlighting the universal value and effectiveness of vaccines.
  • Aims to raise awareness about vaccination and its role in preventing life-threatening diseases.
  • Part of broader efforts like World Immunization Week (April 24–30, 2025) led by WHO.
  • Linked to the Universal Immunization Programme (UIP) launched in 1985, offering free vaccines to pregnant women and children against 12 deadly diseases.

question: What is the theme of International Day of Forests 2025?
option_1: Forests and Climate Action
solution:
• Celebrated annually on March 21, to promote awareness about the importance of forests and their conservation.
  • Declared by the United Nations in 2012, to recognize the vital role forests play in sustaining life on Earth.
  • 2025 theme: Forests and Food — highlights forests’ contribution to food security, nutrition, and livelihoods.
  • Forests provide fruits, nuts, seeds, mushrooms, honey, and wild meat, especially for Indigenous and forest-dependent communities.
  • They support soil fertility, water conservation, biodiversity, and help mitigate climate change.
  • Activities include tree planting, educational campaigns, and policy discussions on sustainable forest management.

question: World Water Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on March 22, as declared by the United Nations General Assembly in 1993.
  • Aims to raise awareness about the importance of freshwater and promote sustainable water management.
  • 2025 theme: Glacier Preservation — emphasizes the urgent need to protect glaciers as vital freshwater sources.
  • Supports Sustainable Development Goal 6 (SDG 6): Water and Sanitation for All by 2030.
  • Encourages global action to address water scarcity, pollution, and sanitation challenges.

question: What is the theme of World Meteorological Day 2025?
option_1: Closing the Early Warning Gap Together
option_2: Forests and Climate Action
option_4: Climate Knowledge for Climate Action
solution:
• Celebrated annually on March 23, marking the establishment of the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) in 1950.
  • First celebrated in 1961, to recognize the global importance of meteorology.
  • 2025 theme: Closing the Early Warning Gap Together — emphasizes the need for inclusive and effective early warning systems to combat climate hazards.
  • Meteorology plays a vital role in public safety, economic well-being, and environmental protection through accurate forecasting and disaster preparedness.
  • WMO is a specialized UN agency, promoting international cooperation in weather, climate, and hydrology.

question: World Tuberculosis Day is observed on which date?
solution:
• Observed annually on March 24, commemorating the day in 1882 when Dr. Robert Koch discovered the TB-causing bacteriumMycobacterium tuberculosis.
  • First marked in 1982, on the centenary of Koch’s discovery, and officially recognized by the World Health Organization (WHO).
  • 2025 theme: Yes! We Can End TB: Commit, Invest, Deliver — a global call for action, funding, and accountability.
  • Purpose: To raise awareness about TB and efforts to eliminate the disease, which remains one of the deadliest infectious killers worldwide.
  • India’s ambitious goal: Eliminate TB by 2025, five years ahead of the global 2030 target.
  • Mission led by NTEP (National Tuberculosis Elimination Programme) — focuses on early detection, treatment, nutrition support, and community engagement.
  • TB is preventable and curable, yet affects millions due to delayed diagnosis, drug resistance, and social stigma.

question: What is the theme of World Health Day 2025?
option_1: My Health, My Right
option_3: Healthy Planet, Healthy People
option_4: Healthy Beginnings, Hopeful Futures
solution:
• Celebrated annually on April 7, marking the founding of the World Health Organization (WHO) in 1948.
  • First celebrated in 1950, to spotlight global health priorities and promote international cooperation.
  • 2025 theme: Healthy Beginnings, Hopeful Futures — focuses on maternal and newborn health, urging action to end preventable deaths and improve long-term well-being.
  • Campaign emphasizes:
    • Safe pregnancies and deliveries
    • Postnatal care and mental health support
    • Equitable access to healthcare for women and infants
  • Encourages governments and health systems to invest in quality care, skilled birth attendants, and community support
  • Reinforces WHO’s mission to ensure health for all, especially in underserved regions.

question: What is the theme of World Heritage Day 2025?
option_1: Preserving the Past for the Future
option_2: Heritage under Threat from Disasters and Conflicts
option_3: Culture and Climate Resilience
solution:
• Celebrated annually on April 18, also known as the International Day for Monuments and Sites.
  • Declared by ICOMOS in 1982, and officially recognized by UNESCO in 1983.
  • First celebrated in 1984, to promote awareness about the importance of cultural and natural heritage.
  • 2025 theme: Heritage under Threat from Disasters and Conflicts: Preparedness and Learning from 60 Years of ICOMOS Actions.
  • Focuses on resilience, disaster preparedness, and conflict mitigation for heritage sites globally.
  • Total UNESCO World Heritage Sites in India (as of 2025): 44 sites
    • 35 Cultural, 7 Natural, 2 Mixed
  • Newest additions (2024–25):
  • Moidams – Mound-Burial System of the Ahom Dynasty (Assam)
  • Maratha Military Landscapes — includes 12 forts across Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu, such as:
  • Raigad, Rajgad, Shivneri, Pratapgad, Lohgad, Salher, Sindhudurg, Vijaydurg, Suvarnadurg, Khanderi, Panhala (Maharashtra)
  • Gingee Fort (Tamil Nadu)

question: Earth Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on April 22, Earth Day is a global event dedicated to environmental protection and sustainability.
  • First observed in 1970, inspired by the 1969 Santa Barbara oil spill, and led by Senator Gaylord Nelson and activist Denis Hayes.
  • 2025 theme: Our Power, Our Planet — emphasizes the shift to renewable energy and collective climate action.
  • Earth Day encourages tree planting, clean-up drives, climate education, and policy advocacy.
  • It’s observed in over 190 countries, mobilizing millions of people to take action for a healthier planet.

question: World Press Freedom Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on May 3, to honor the principles of press freedom and recognize the sacrifices of journalists worldwide.
  • Proclaimed by the UN General Assembly in 1993, inspired by the 1991 Windhoek Declaration advocating for a free, independent, and pluralistic press.
  • 2025 theme: Reporting in the Brave New World – The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Press Freedom and the Media
    • Focuses on how AI is reshaping journalism, media ethics, and freedom of expression.
    • Highlights both opportunities and risks — including misinformation, surveillance, and bias.
  • Promotes media independence, journalist safety, and public access to accurate information, aligned with SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions.

question: World Red Cross Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on May 8, marking the birth anniversary of Henry Dunant, founder of the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) and the first recipient of the Nobel Peace Prize in 1901.
  • First celebrated in 1948, to honor humanitarian service and promote the values of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement.
  • 2025 theme: Keeping Humanity Alive — emphasizes the role of volunteers in delivering hope, help, and healing during crises.
  • Recognizes the life-saving work of Red Cross and Red Crescent staff and volunteers in disaster zones, war-torn areas, and health emergencies.
  • Promotes the seven fundamental principles: Humanity, Impartiality, Neutrality, Independence, Voluntary Service, Unity, Universality.
  • Encourages global action to support humanitarian aid, peacebuilding, and community resilience.

question: International Tea Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on May 21, as declared by the United Nations General Assembly in 2019, to honor tea’s cultural, economic, and social significance.
  • First observed in 2020, led by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO).
  • 2025 theme: Tea for Better Lives — focuses on tea’s role in health, sustainability, and livelihoods.
  • Tea supports over 13 million people globally, especially smallholder farmers in developing countries.
  • Promotes fair trade, sustainable farming, and economic empowerment, especially for women in the tea sector.
  • Tea is the second most consumed beverage in the world after water, with deep cultural roots in countries like India, China, Japan, and the UK.
  • Largest producer of tea in the world: China, with over 4 million metric tons annually, followed by India.

question: International Day of Biodiversity is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on May 22, to commemorate the adoption of the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) on this date in 1992.
  • Proclaimed by the UN General Assembly in 2001, shifting the date from December 29 to enable better global participation.
  • 2025 theme: Harmony with Nature and Sustainable Development — emphasizes biodiversity’s role in achieving the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
  • Aims to raise awareness about biodiversity conservation and sustainable development, highlighting the link between ecological health and human progress.
  • Biodiversity supports:
    • Food security
    • Clean water and air
    • Climate regulation
    • Medicinal resources
  • The campaign aligns with the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework (KMGBF), urging nations to integrate biodiversity into national development strategies.

question: World Anti-Tobacco Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on May 31, this global observance is also known as World No Tobacco Day.
  • Initiated by the World Health Organization (WHO) in 1987, to draw attention to the tobacco epidemic and its preventable health consequences.
  • 2025 theme: Bright Products. Dark Intentions. Unmasking the Appeal — focuses on exposing deceptive marketing tactics used by tobacco and nicotine industries, especially targeting youth.
  • Purpose:
    • To raise awareness about the dangers of tobacco use
    • To advocate for effective policies to reduce consumption
    • To protect current and future generations from addiction and disease
  • Tobacco use causes over 8 million deaths annually, making it the leading cause of preventable death worldwide.

question: What is the theme of World Environment Day 2025?
option_2: Climate Action for All
option_3: Green Choices, Global Impact
solution:
• Celebrated annually on June 5, World Environment Day is the largest global platform for environmental outreach, observed by millions across more than 150 countries.
  • First celebrated in 1973, following its establishment at the 1972 Stockholm Conference on the Human Environment, and led by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP).
  • 2025 theme: Beat Plastic Pollution — focuses on tackling the global plastic crisis that threatens ecosystems, wildlife, and human health.
  • The campaign urges:
    • Reduction of single-use plastics
    • Promotion of sustainable alternatives
    • Transition to circular economies
  • Host country (2025): Republic of Korea, with global celebrations held in Jeju Province, known for its innovative waste management systems.
  • Plastic pollution contributes to the triple planetary crisis:
    • Climate change
    • Biodiversity loss
    • Pollution and waste
  • The observance aligns with efforts to secure a global treaty to end plastic pollution, reinforcing commitments made in 2022.

question: World Blood Donation Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on June 14, to raise awareness about the importance of safe blood donation and to thank voluntary donors for their life-saving contributions.
  • Also known as World Blood Donor Day, it was initiated by the World Health Organization (WHO) in 1987 and officially recognized in 2005.
  • Observed on the birthday of Karl Landsteiner, the Nobel Prize-winning scientist who discovered the ABO blood group system, revolutionizing modern blood transfusion practices.
  • 2025 theme: Give Blood, Give Hope: Together We Save Lives — emphasizes the emotional and life-saving impact of regular blood donations.
  • Blood donations support patients in:
    • Accidents and trauma care
    • Surgeries and cancer treatments
    • Maternal health and anemia cases
    • Blood disorders like thalassemia and hemophilia

question: What is the theme of International Day of Yoga 2025?
option_2: Yoga for Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam
option_3: Yoga for Climate Action
option_4: Yoga for One Earth, One Health
solution:
• Celebrated annually on June 21, International Day of Yoga was proclaimed by the United Nations in 2014, following India’s proposal led by PM Narendra Modi.
  • First celebrated in 2015, the day promotes awareness of yoga’s benefits for physical, mental, and spiritual well-being.
  • 2025 theme: Yoga for One Earth, One Health — emphasizes the interconnectedness of personal health, planetary wellness, and sustainability.
  • The theme aligns with India’s G20 vision: One Earth, One Family, One Future, and supports the UN Decade on Ecosystem Restoration (2021–2030).
  • Signature events include:
    • Yoga Sangam: Mass synchronized yoga sessions across 1 lakh+ locations
    • Yoga Bandhan: Global collaborations with partner countries
    • Harit Yoga: Tree planting and eco-conscious yoga drives
    • Yoga Samavesh: Inclusive yoga for special groups (e.g. seniors, children, pregnant women)
  • The day encourages people worldwide to embrace yoga as a lifestyle, fostering harmony between body, mind, and nature.

question: National Doctor’s Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Observed annually on July 1, National Doctor’s Day honors the dedication and contributions of doctors and healthcare professionals across India.
  • The date commemorates both the birth and death anniversary of Dr. Bidhan Chandra Roy, a legendary physician and the second Chief Minister of West Bengal.
  • First celebrated in 1991, the day was instituted by the Government of India to recognize the vital role of medical professionals in public health.
  • 2025 theme: Behind the Mask: Who Heals the Healers? — highlighting the emotional and mental well-being of doctors.
  • The day encourages appreciation for doctors’ tireless service and promotes awareness about their challenges, especially in high-pressure environments.

question: World Population Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated annually on July 11, World Population Day was first observed in 1989, inspired by Five Billion Day — the milestone when the global population reached 5 billion on July 11, 1987.
  • The day was established by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) to raise awareness about global population issues and their impact on development and sustainability.
  • 2025 theme: Empowering Young People to Create the Families They Want in a Fair and Hopeful World — focuses on youth rights, reproductive choices, and inclusive development.
  • The observance highlights challenges such as:
    • Overpopulation and resource strain
    • Access to education and healthcare
    • Gender equality and family planning
    • Sustainable urban growth and climate resilience
  • It encourages governments and communities to adopt inclusive policies that support informed decision-making and equitable opportunities.

question: Which international day is celebrated on September 8?
solution:
• International Literacy Day is celebrated every year on September 8, as declared by UNESCO in 1966 and first observed in 1967.
  • The day aims to raise awareness about global literacy challenges and promote literacy as a human right and foundation for lifelong learning.
  • It was inspired by the 1965 World Conference of Ministers of Education on the Eradication of Illiteracy held in Tehran.
  • 2024 theme: Promoting Multilingual Education: Literacy for Mutual Understanding and Peace — emphasizes the role of first-language-based literacy in fostering social cohesion and intercultural dialogue.
  • Literacy is essential for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), especially those related to education, equality, and peace.
  • Events include community workshops, policy dialogues, and educational campaigns across schools, libraries, and civil society organizations.

question: Which international day is celebrated on September 16?
option_3: World Climate Action Day
solution:
• World Ozone Day, officially known as the International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer, is celebrated every year on September 16.
  • The day was proclaimed by the United Nations General Assembly in 1994 to raise awareness about the importance of protecting the ozone layer.
  • It commemorates the signing of the Montreal Protocol Treaty, adopted on September 16, 1987 in Montreal, Canada, and entered into force on January 1, 1989.
  • The Montreal Protocol is considered one of the most successful environmental agreements, showcasing effective global cooperation in tackling ozone depletion.
  • The ozone layer acts as Earth’s shield, absorbing harmful ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun.
  • 2024 theme: Montreal Protocol: Advancing Climate Actions — highlights the treaty’s role not only in ozone protection but also in mitigating climate change through the phase-out of ozone-depleting substances.
  • Activities include educational campaigns, tree planting, policy dialogues, and scientific exhibitions to promote eco-conscious behavior.

question: What is the theme of World Tourism Day 2024?
option_4: Tourism for Cultural Unity
solution:
• Celebrated annually on September 27, World Tourism Day was established in 1980 by the United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO) to highlight tourism’s social, cultural, and economic value.
  • 2024 theme: Tourism and Peace — emphasizes how travel, cultural exchange, and sustainable tourism can foster global harmony, reconciliation, and cooperation.
  • Tourism promotes:
    • Cross-cultural understanding
    • Economic interdependence
    • Peacebuilding through shared experiences
  • The day encourages responsible and inclusive tourism, showcasing its role in conflict resolution and community development.
  • Host country (2024): Georgia, with celebrations held in Tbilisi, highlighting its rich heritage and commitment to peaceful tourism practices.

question: Which international day is celebrated on October 11?
option_2: International Day of the Girl Child
solution:
• International Day of the Girl Child is celebrated every year on October 11, as declared by the United Nations General Assembly in 2011.
  • The day aims to promote girls’ rights, highlight the unique challenges faced by girls worldwide, and advocate for their empowerment and inclusion.
  • It was inspired by the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action (1995), the first global policy framework to specifically call out girls’ rights.
  • 2024 theme: Girls’ Vision for the Future — emphasizes the power of girls’ voices and their hopeful aspirations for a world where they are protected, respected, and empowered.
  • The observance supports efforts to achieve gender equality, improve access to education and healthcare, and end child marriage and gender-based violence.
  • Events include school campaigns, policy dialogues, and community outreach programs across countries.

question: World Food Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
World Food Day is celebrated every year on October 16, marking the founding of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations in 1945. First observed in 1981, the day raises awareness about global hunger, food security, and the need for sustainable agrifood systems.

2024 theme: “Right to Food for a Better Life and a Better Future” — emphasizes that food is not just a basic need but a fundamental human right, as recognized by the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

The day calls for equitable access to safe, nutritious, and affordable food, especially for vulnerable populations. It also promotes sustainable agriculture, resilient food systems, and global cooperation to combat hunger and malnutrition.

question: World Polio Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Observed annually on October 24, World Polio Day was established by Rotary International to honor the birth of Dr. Jonas Salk, who developed the first effective polio vaccine in 1955.
  • The day aims to raise awareness about polio eradication and recognize the efforts of healthcare workers and global organizations fighting this disease.
  • India was declared polio-free in 2014 by the World Health Organization — a landmark achievement in public health.
  • Polio is a highly infectious viral disease that can cause irreversible paralysis, especially in children under five.
  • 2024 theme: “A Global Mission to Reach Every Child” — focuses on ensuring universal vaccination and protecting children in vulnerable regions.

question: World Cities Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Observed annually on October 31, World Cities Day was first celebrated in 2014, following a UN resolution to promote sustainable urban development.
  • 2024 theme: “Youth Leading Climate and Local Action for Cities” — highlights the role of young people in driving climate resilience and urban innovation.
  • The day concludes Urban October, a month-long campaign by UN-Habitat to spotlight urban challenges and solutions.
  • Focus areas include:
  • Youth-led green infrastructure and climate adaptation
  • Local governance and inclusive city planning
  • Sustainable Development Goal 11: Making cities inclusive, safe, resilient, and sustainable.

question: World Diabetes Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated every year on November 14, World Diabetes Day marks the birthday of Sir Frederick Banting, co-discoverer of insulin.
  • 2024 theme: “Breaking Barriers, Bridging Gaps” — focuses on equitable access to diabetes care, especially for underserved communities.
  • The campaign promotes:
    • Universal access to insulin and diagnostics
    • Mental health support for diabetics
    • Community outreach and education
  • Led by the International Diabetes Federation (IDF) and supported by WHO, the day aims to reduce stigma and improve quality of life for those affected.

question: World AIDS Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Observed annually on December 1, World AIDS Day was first commemorated in 1988, making it one of the longest-running global health awareness days.
  • 2024 theme: “Take the Rights Path: My Health, My Right” — emphasizes human rights, health equity, and inclusive HIV care.
  • The campaign advocates for:
    • Ending stigma and discrimination
    • Universal access to antiretroviral therapy (ART)
    • Legal protections for vulnerable populations
  • Supported by UNAIDS, WHO, and global partners, the day calls for community-led action to end AIDS as a public health threat by 2030.

question: Which international day is celebrated on December 2?
option_1: World Computer Literacy Day
option_4: International Day for the Abolition of Slavery
solution:
• World Computer Literacy Day is celebrated on December 2 to promote digital literacy, especially among children and women, and to bridge the digital divide.
    • 2024 theme: “Literacy for Human-Centred Recovery: Narrowing the Digital Divide” — focuses on inclusive tech education for post-pandemic resilience.
  • International Day for the Abolition of Slavery is also observed on December 2, aiming to raise awareness about modern slavery, including human trafficking, forced labor, and child exploitation.
  • The day reinforces global efforts to uphold human rights and dignity.

question: Which international day is celebrated on December 11?
solution:
• International Mountain Day is celebrated on December 11, established by the United Nations in 2003 to highlight the importance of mountains in ecosystem balance, water supply, and biodiversity.
    • 2024 theme: “Mountain Solutions for a Sustainable Future: Innovation, Adaptation and Youth” — emphasizes the role of young people and innovation in protecting mountain environments.
  • UNICEF Day is also observed on December 11, marking the founding of the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund (UNICEF) in 1946, which works to ensure child rights, education, and health globally.

question: Savitribai Phule Jayanti is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• The day marks the birth anniversary of India’s first woman teacher, Savitribai Phule.
  • The celebration began in 1858, initiated by her husband Mahatma Jyotirao Phule, but it was officially recognized as a state holiday in the early 2000s, particularly in Maharashtra.
  • In 1848, Savitribai and her husband established India’s first school for girls in Pune, pioneering inclusive education during colonial rule.
  • She bravely fought against caste discrimination, child marriage, and widow oppression, and advocated for widow remarriage.
  • She and Jyotirao also promoted social reform through the Aatmiya Sabha — a discussion forum founded in the 1870s to oppose religious orthodoxy and untouchability.
  • Jyotirao Phule’s powerful book ‘Gulamgiri’ (Slavery), published in 1873, dedicated to African-American slaves, also reflected their shared mission to challenge social injustice.

question: Which national day is celebrated on January 16?
solution:
• National Start-up Day is observed every year on January 16, as announced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2022 under the Startup India Initiative, which began in 2016.
  • The day aims to promote start-up culture in India and build a strong and inclusive ecosystem for innovation and entrepreneurship.
  • 2025 theme: “Let’s Shape the Future Together – One Innovative Idea at a Time” — emphasizes collaborative creativity and support for scalable solutions.
  • Celebrations include pitch contests, mentoring workshops, innovation exhibitions, and policy dialogues.
  • Other options:
    1. National Youth Day – celebrated on January 12, marking the birth anniversary of Swami Vivekananda.
    2. National Voters Day – celebrated on January 25, to encourage electoral participation, especially among the youth.
    3. National Innovation Day – not officially marked on January 16; innovation is recognized through various dates and initiatives.

question: Patriot Day / Parakram Diwas is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Parakram Diwas is celebrated every year on January 23 to honor the birth anniversary of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, one of India’s most iconic freedom fighters.
  • The day commemorates his legacy of courage and patriotism during the Indian Independence Movement.
  • It was first officially celebrated in 2021, as declared by the Government of India on his 124th birth anniversary.
  • In 2022, a hologram statue of Netaji was unveiled at India Gate, which was later replaced by a grand permanent statue.
  • Netaji established the Indian National Army (Azad Hind Fauj) in 1943 and founded the Forward Bloc in 1939 to intensify the freedom struggle.
  • His famous slogan: “Give me blood, and I will give you freedom” continues to inspire generations.

question: Data Privacy Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Observed on January 28, commemorating Convention 108 (1981) — first global data protection treaty.
  • Dedicated to raising awareness about protecting personal information and responsible digital behavior.
  • Aims to educate individuals on privacy principles, encouraging user empowerment in the digital age.
  • 2025 Theme: “Privacy in the Age of AI” — highlights ethical data practices amidst rising AI technologies.
  • Data Privacy Week: 27–31 January 2025, theme “Take Control of Your Data” — promotes digital autonomy.
  • The right to privacy is a fundamental human right, enshrined in Article 12 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (1948) and Article 17 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (1966).
  • In India, it was affirmed as a constitutional right under Article 21 by the Supreme Court in the Justice K.S. Puttaswamy (Retd.) v. Union of India (2017) case.

question: Samarpan Diwas is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Samarpan Diwas is observed annually on February 11 to commemorate the death anniversary of Deendayal Upadhyaya, a renowned Indian political thinker and leader.
  • He was the leader of Bharatiya Jana Sangh (BJS), the ideological predecessor of the present-day BJP.
  • Deendayal Upadhyaya is credited for drafting BJS’s official political doctrine — Integral Humanism, which combined cultural nationalism with Gandhian socialist principles like sarvodaya (progress of all) and swadeshi (self-sufficiency).
  • His philosophy emphasized national unity, grassroots development, and ethical public life.

question: Swatantrya Veer Gaurav Diwas is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Swatantrya Veer Gaurav Diwas is celebrated on May 28, marking the birth anniversary of freedom fighter Vinayak Damodar Savarkar.
  • In 2023, Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Eknath Shinde, officially declared this day to honor Savarkar’s legacy.
  • Savarkar developed the concept of Hindutva, promoting cultural nationalism.
  • He founded the Abhinav Bharat Society and later led the Hindu Mahasabha, advocating for national unity.
  • His book “The Indian War of Independence”, based on the 1857 revolt, was banned by the British for its revolutionary content.
  • He opposed the Quit India Movement and supported British war efforts, believing in strategic resistance.

question: Constitution Assassination / Murder Day is observed on which date?
solution:
• Observed on June 25, Constitution Assassination Day (Samvidhan Hatya Diwas) was officially declared by the Government of India in 2024.
  • It commemorates the struggles of those who opposed the Emergency, a period from June 25, 1975 to March 21, 1977, when civil liberties were suspended.
  • The Emergency was declared by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi under Article 352 (National Emergency) of the Constitution.
  • Other related constitutional provisions:
    • Article 356 – State Emergency
    • Article 360 – Financial Emergency (never invoked in India)
  • The day serves as a reminder of democratic resilience and the importance of safeguarding constitutional values.

question: Which national day is celebrated on August 23?
solution:
• National Space Day is celebrated on August 23, declared by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2023 to honor the success of Chandrayaan-3.
  • On this day, India became the fourth country to land on the Moon and the first to reach its southern polar region.
  • Mission Highlights:
    • Lander: Vikram
    • Rover: Pragyaan
  • 2024 Theme: “Touching Lives while Touching the Moon: India’s Space Saga” — celebrates the societal impact of India’s space journey.

Other options’ dates:

  • National Science Day – February 28, commemorates the discovery of the Raman Effect by C.V. Raman in 1928.
  • National Technology Day – May 11, marks India’s Pokhran nuclear tests in 1998.
  • National Astronomy Day – celebrated twice a year, typically in Spring (May) and Fall (September/October), based on the first quarter Moon.

question: Hyderabad Liberation Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Celebrated on September 17, Hyderabad Liberation Day marks the liberation of Hyderabad from Nizam rule and its integration into India in 1948.

• This was achieved through Operation Polo, a military action led by Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, which ended the resistance by the Nizam’s private militia, the Razakars.

• The official celebration of this day was announced by the Government of India on March 12, 2024.

question: National Dolphin Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• National Dolphin Day in India is celebrated on October 5, as designated by the Union Environment Ministry to promote awareness and conservation of dolphins.

• Globally, it is observed on April 14, highlighting the importance of dolphins in marine ecosystems.

• The day aims to increase awareness about the significance of dolphins and the need to safeguard them from threats like pollution and habitat loss.

• The Gangetic River Dolphin is recognized as the National Aquatic Animal of India, symbolizing a healthy river ecosystem.

question: Namo Bharat Day is observed on which date?
solution:
• Namo Bharat Day is observed on 21 October
  • It marks the anniversary of Namo Bharat Train operations in India
  • Namo Bharat is India’s first Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS)
  • Inaugurated on 21 October 2023 by PM Narendra Modi
  • First operational route: Sahibabad to Duhai Depot (Uttar Pradesh)
  • It reflects progress in high-speed regional connectivity and modern transport infrastructure

question: International Biosphere Reserve Day is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• International Biosphere Reserve Day is celebrated on 3 November
  • Observance recognizes the role of biosphere reserves in environmental and community development
  • Established in 2021 during the 41st Session of the UNESCO General Conference
  • Aims to promote conservation, sustainable development, and well-being of people in and around these reserves
  • 2025 Theme: “Harmony with nature and sustainable development”
  • Encourages global participation in preserving natural ecosystems while benefiting local communitie

question: Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas is celebrated on which date?
solution:
• Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas is celebrated on 15 November
  • Officially declared in 2021 by the Government of India
  • Marks the birth anniversary of Birsa Munda, a revered tribal leader and freedom fighter
  • Celebrated to honor the contributions of tribal freedom fighters in India’s Independence movement
  • Related landmark: Birsa Munda Hockey Stadium – Odisha, named in his memory
  • It is the world’s largest hockey stadium, symbolizing tribal legacy and sporting excellence
  • The day reflects tribal pride, cultural heritage, and historical importance

question: 6 December is observed as which day?
option_4: Peace and Cooperation Day
solution:
• Maitri Diwas is observed on 6 December
  • It marks the anniversary of India's recognition of Bangladesh as an independent nation in 1971
  • Announced during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Bangladesh in March 2021
  • Celebrated in 18 countries, including USA, UK, Russia, Japan, France, and UAE
  • The day signifies deep friendship and shared sacrifices between India and Bangladesh

question: 26 December is observed as which day?
option_2: Guru Legacy Memorial Day
solution:
• Veer Baal Diwas is observed on 26 December
  • It pays homage to the bravery and martyrdom of the four sons of Guru Gobind Singh Ji, the tenth Sikh Guru
  • Officially declared by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2022
  • Especially commemorates Sahibzada Zorawar Singh Ji and Sahibzada Fateh Singh Ji,
  • The two young sons were executed by Mughal forces at ages six and nine for refusing to convert to Islam
  • The day honors unwavering faith, courage, and sacrifice made at such a tender age
